All curled up in Starice�s arms the baby began to fall asleep, her breathing 
slower and more gentle.
Her tummy was full of milk and she was just a cozy bundle of fur in 
Starice�s grasp. Finally, with the soothing sounds of Starice�s speech, she 
managed to slip into a peaceful rest.
In what dreams a baby her size could ever have, there were clouds with stars 
in them and around them too. There was no moon, but soft music was all 
around. Soothing and slow. And from somewhere, the sounds of singing words 
came, even beyond the blue/black sky that was all around the clouds.
� Somewhere, secretly,
we�de all like to go.
Somewhere safe in dreams,
Where no one else can go.
Away from the crowd, where no one can find us,
With night all tumbling down. Where we tumble and slide on a magical ride.
Don�t wake, you�d have to come down.�
That was mommy! The same soothing sounds even though the tiny one couldn�t 
make out words yet.
But the baby remembered because it was the last thing she had heard that was 
recognized as mommy. Well, almost. There was one last thing that her mother 
had said to her.
� Goodnight, my little Queen of the Meadows. My beautiful Eyebright.�
And from there there was nothing else. Never again had she heard the song of 
her mother, or taste her milk, feel the warmth of her side or smell her 
scent. And never again would she know those things, and soon even, she would 
forget them. But one thing her tiny mind would hang onto and would always, 
��Queen of the Meadows, �beautiful Eyebright.�
